business.headline: Microsoft plans job cuts in 2025, targets low-performing employeesMicrosoft layoffs: In 2023, the company cut an estimated 10,000 jobs, amounting to roughly 5% of its global workforce.

Stocks to watch today: TCS, Tata Motors, IREDA, BHEL, NTPC Green EnergyStocks such as TCS, Tata Motors, IREDA, BHEL, Tata Elxsi, etc are expected to remain in focus due to various developments and announcements.
Budget 2025: What is Economic Survey, when it's released, and why it mattersThe Economic Survey offers key insights into India's economy, guiding the Union Budget and future growth.
Instant loans for housewives: A step-by-step guideInstant personal loans offer housewives quick financial relief with easy application, affordable rates, and fast approval.

Swiggy launches new standalone app SNACC. Here's all you need to know The app, which is currently available in select Bengaluru neighbourhoods, is aimed at urban consumers who prioritise speed and convenience when it comes to food delivery.

GDP growth in FY25 may hit 4-year low. Is Indian economy losing steam?While a slowdown in the ongoing financial year was anticipated, the steep downward revision in GDP growth for FY25 has taken many by surprise.

RBI's new credit reporting rules: Check how it will affect loan borrowersFrom January 1, 2025, RBI's bi-monthly credit updates aim to boost credit scores, empower borrowers, and improve lender risk assessments.
Budget 2025: Easier ITR filing and tax dispute reduction expected, says reportBudget 2025 aims to simplify tax filing, reduce disputes, and foster a transparent, taxpayer-friendly system.

Sensex, Nifty end lower in volatile session; Reliance jumps nearly 2%Stock market today: The S&P BSE Sensex ended 50.62 points lower to 78,148.49 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 18.95 points to 23,688.95.
PAN card fraud: Know details, how to stay safe from phishing scamA new phishing scam claiming PAN card updates is targeting India Post Payments Bank customers, with PIB urging caution.
Reliance share price jumps nearly 2%. Is there more upside and should you buy?Reliance share price: At 3:26 pm on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), RIL shares were trading 1.81% higher at Rs 1,263.30.

India's power output growth in 2024 slowest since pandemic: ReportThe deceleration was especially pronounced in the second half of the year, where power generation rose by only 2.3%, compared to a 9.6% rise in the first half.
Budget 2025: Can you expect Rs 10 lakh tax-free income?As Budget 2025 nears, the Bharatiya Mazdoor Sangh calls for tax reforms, pension hikes, and worker benefits to ease middle-class burdens.

Sensex tumbles 600 points today. 3 reasons why stock market is falling Stock market today: Multiple factors were behind today's nervousness on Dalal Street, including weaker growth estimates for FY25, worries over Q3 corporate earnings and the likelihood of fewer US rate cuts.
'Real money is with Gujjus': Nithin Kamath on equity trade dominanceNithin Kamath revealed Mumbai and Ahmedabad drive 80% of equity trades, despite Gujarat having only 8% of registered investors.

Explained: Why Spandana Sphoorty share price surged over 15% todaySpandana Sphoorty share price: At around 10 am, Spandana Sphoorty shares were trading at Rs 461.40 on the National Stock Exchange (NSE), marking a remarkable 35% gain in just two days. By 12:56 pm, the stock had risen 14.62% to Rs 459, signalling strong investor interest.

Delta Autocorp IPO: Check latest GMP, subscription status on Day 2Delta Autocorp IPO: The IPO opened for subscription on Tuesday and has already been subscribed 13.81 times as of the end of Day 1. By Wednesday afternoon, subscription levels continued to rise, with the issue subscribed 29.54 times as of 12:33 pm.

Budget 2025: Salaried earners up to Rs 15 lakh may get tax relief. Details hereBudget 2025-26 may offer tax benefits for incomes up to Rs 15 lakh, boosting disposable income and driving economic growth.

Zomato share price tumbles 3% today as poor market run continues. What's next?  Zomato's shares had already fallen nearly 5% in the previous session, contributing to an 11% drop over the past five trading days. Over the last month, the stock has lost more than 16% of its value.

Explained: Why Ola Electric share price fell over 5% todayOla Electric stock price: The shares of the company hit a low of Rs 75.36 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), down 4.8% during the session. At around 11:35 am, shares of the company recovered slightly, but were still trading 1.47% lower at Rs 78.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Gates opened to let unwell woman out, then chaos: What caused Tirupati stampedeA stampede at Tirumala's Lord Venkateswara Swamy temple left six dead and several injured. Devotees gathered early for Vaikunta Dwara Darshanam tokens. Officials visited the hospital to ensure proper care for the injured.

UK MPs vote against grooming gangs inquiry; Starmer, opposition leader clashLawmakers from the ruling Labour Party have slammed the opposition for attempting to kill the Children's Wellbeing and Schools Bill by tabling an amendment that would force the new inquiry, while blocking the bill at the same time.

He wanted to protect fish over Californians: Trump blames wildfires on GovernorPresident-elect Donald Trump criticised California Governor Gavin Newsom and President Joe Biden for mismanaging wildfires in Southern California, accusing them of prioritising environmental concerns over residents safety.

Rahul Gandhi smirked, but I invite him to watch Emergency: Kangana RanautKangana Ranaut has invited Rahul Gandhi to watch Emergency, though she remarked that he 'lacks etiquette'. She praised Priyanka Gandhi for being courteous. The film, based on Indira Gandhi, releases on January 17.

Gentle reminder: It's the little lifestyle changes that will make 2025 healthierFrom increasing water intake and making small dietary changes to ditching phone usage while eating, these simple lifestyle adjustments can make a significant impact on your well-being.

Chief Justice, Supreme Court judges plan private holiday in Andhra Pradesh: SourcesChief Justice of India, Sanjiv Khanna, and 24 other Supreme Court judges, along with their families, will visit Vishakhapatnam and Araku Valley from January 11-14. The trip, described as an informal gathering, will be funded personally using Leave Travel Concession (LTC).

Hatred of humanity: Elon Musk attacks George Soros for 'funding pro-Hamas NGOs'Elon Musk has accused American investor George Soros of "fundamentally hating humanity" and actively working to undermine the foundations of civilisation.

Isro postpones SpaDeX docking again, says satellites are safeThe Indian space agency stated that the issue arose during a manoeuvre to reduce the distance between the satellites to 225 meters, with the drift exceeding expectations after a non-visibility period.

Toyota Camry Review, first drive: Camry performs its KaizenThe ninth generation of the Camry gently performs its kaizen or natural evolution without the need to scoreboard watch the rest of the playing field. It is an all-new gen but forged by the same guiding principal.

Indian diaspora groups slam use of term 'Asian' in UK child sex abuse scandalIndian diaspora groups in the UK objected to the term 'Asian' used in reference to a child sexual abuse scandal involving Pakistani heritage gangs. They call for accurate reporting and criticise political correctness.
Celebrated poet, filmmaker and writer Pritish Nandy dies at 73Writer and filmmaker Pritish Nandy died on Wednesday, January 8, at the age of 73.

Sudden hair loss among residents of 3 Maharashtra villages sparks panicAfter receiving constant reports of a number of people facing sudden hair fall, officials of the district health department reached Bondgaon, Kalwad and Hingna villages and launched an investigation and examined the patients.

Dhanashree Verma reacts to divorce rumours with Yuzvendra Chahal: Truth stands tallActor and dancer Dhanashree Verma reacted to the divorce rumours with her cricketer-husband, Yuzvendra Chahal. She shared a lengthy post on social media to hit back at the trolls.

Foreign Secretary meets Taliban Minister; cricket, India-Afghan ties discussedThe two sides discussed about various issues pertaining to bilateral relations as well as regional developments, the Ministry of External Affairs said in a statement.

Priyanka Chopra onboard Oscar-nominated film Anuja as executive producerPriyanka Chopra has joined the Oscars 2025 shortlisted film Anuja as the executive producer. The movie has been shortlisted in the live-action short film category.

Shiv temple 'locked for over 100 years' reopened in Varanasi The Siddheshwar Mahadev temple in Madanpura, closed for centuries, was reopened with police and administrative support. Following a request by the Sanatan Rakshak Dal, the temple's restoration will begin after Kharmas, with a reinstallation ceremony planned for the damaged lingams.

Gautam Gambhir vs Andrew McDonald: How the Australian think tank outwitted IndiaIndia were hammered by Australia in the 5-match Test series. Not only was the team outplayed on the field, but off it, the Australian team management outsmarted Gautam Gambhir, Abhishek Nayar, Morne Morkel, and Ryan ten Doeschate.

Actress Pamela Anderson 'almost got killed on a plane' in identity mix-upPamela Anderson recounted a bizarre flight experience in a recent podcast. A passenger, mistakenly believing her to be Natalie Maines of The Chicks, became enraged due to the band's past political stance.

Trump back in power, Mark Zuckerberg uses it to throw facts under the busWith Donald Trump set to be the next US president, everyone in Silicon Valley is using this moment to get in his good books. But Mark Zuckerberg, by getting rid of fact-checking on Facebook, is doing something more: He is trying to curry favours with Trump as well as getting rid of something that he always found irritating.

2 London residents try to smuggle Indians into UK in van compartment, arrestedTwo Londoners, Shafaz Khan and Choudhry Rashied, were sentenced to five years and three months in prison for attempting to smuggle four Indian migrants into the UK. The migrants were found hidden in a van compartment at Newhaven Ferry Port in March 2019.

Why Rohit Sharma is right, but so are the critics with 'mic, laptop or pen'The pens will write, the microphones will analyse and the laptops will record—because that is their job, just as scoring runs and leading the team is Sharma's

Unprofessional actors should shut up: Ekta Kapoor after Ram Kapoor's remarksEkta Kapoor called out 'unprofessional actors' after Ram Kapoor spoke about a controversial kissing scene in Bade Achhe Lagte Hain. Ram revealed he had reservations about the scene, but Ekta wanted it.

Yet to get 40 Tejas ordered in 2010: IAF chief as China tests sixth-gen jetsIndian Air Force (IAF) chief AP Singh has raised concerns over China's astonishing pace of air force modernisation while expressing frustration over the sluggish pace of the delivery of Tejas jets.

Afghan woman given police protection amid threats from Hindu husband's familyThe Bombay High Court extended police protection to an Afghan woman and her sister, citing credible threats to their lives following an interfaith marriage.

Yash's Toxic release plans: Pan-India tour to grand trailer event, all we knowKannada actor Yash is currently shooting for his upcoming film, Toxic. The makers have drafted an elaborate strategy to promote the film, catering to the actor's pan-India fan base.

Critics Choice Awards postponed, premieres cancelled due to Los Angeles wildfiresCritics' Choice Awards 2025 has been postponed to a later date due to Los Angeles wildfires. Many Hollywood events and premieres, including BAFTA Tea Party, have been cancelled.

sports.headline: Why India shouldn't forget Shreyas Iyer in Champions Trophy 2025 squadFrom Vijay Hazare's heroics to ODI World Cup brilliance, Shreyas Iyer's sensational form makes him a strong contender for India's Champions Trophy 2025 squad. Can India afford to overlook this middle-order powerhouse?

Arne Slot criticises decision not to send off Bergvall after Spurs beat LiverpoolLiverpool manager Arne Slot believes Lucas Bergvall, who opened his Tottenham Hotspur account with the winner in League Cup semi-final first leg, should not even have been on the pitch.

Barcelona's Dani Olmo, Pau Víctor granted temporary registrationDani Olmo and Pau Víctor were granted temporary playing registrations while Spain's top sports court investigates Barcelona's appeal against LaLiga and the Spanish Football Federation (RFEF).

Bumrah leads from the front, will be India's next captain: Sunil GavaskarSunil Gavaskar has explained why Jasprit Bumrah will become the next India captain after his performance during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy against australia. Bumrah's captaincy received immense praise from all corners.

Steve Smith to lead spin-heavy Australia in Sri Lanka Tests, no rest for StarcSteve Smith has been named Australia's captain for their tour of Sri Lanka without regular skipper Pat Cummins, said Cricket Australia. Mitchell Starc leads the pace attack in an otherwise spin-heavy squad.

Bangladesh wait on Shakib's test results for Champions Trophy selection Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) is eagerly waiting for the test results of Shakib Al Hasan's bowling action before naming their squad for the Champions Trophy to be held in February.

HIL: Hyderabad claim crucial win, Dragons edge past Gonasika in thrillerHyderabad Toofans secured a crucial 3-0 win over the UP Rudras while Jip Janssen scored a memorable hat-trick as Tamil Nadu Dragons edged past Team Gonasika in a 11-goal thriller in the Hockey India League on Wednesday, January 8.

Gracious in defeat, Alcaraz congratulates De Minaur on engagement Australian Open 2025: Carlos Alcaraz congratulated Alex de Minaur on his engagement with Katie Boulter last December. On Wednesday, Alcaraz lost to de Minaur in an exhibition match at the Melbourne Park.

West Ham United sack coach Julen Lopetegui, Graham Potter in talks for roleWest Ham United have announced that they have sacked head coach Julen Lopetegui after a poor first half to the season. Former Chelsea and Brighton manager Graham Potter is in talks to be the replacement for Lopetegui.

Indian Steve Smith? Young batter imitates Australian batter, watch videoIn a video on social media, a young batter imitated Australian cricket maestro Steve Smith with astonishing accuracy. Smith recently finished as the third-highest run-scorer in the Test series against India.

Not good for the game: Smith slams ILT20 for ignoring local cricketSA20 commissioner Graeme Smith has expressed concerns about the UAE's ILT20, stating that leagues of this nature are "not good for the game." Smith criticized the ILT20 for prioritizing international players over nurturing local talent, highlighting a lack of focus on developing the domestic cricketing ecosystem.

Zinedine Zidane new France coach? French football president remains tight-lippedFrench Football Federation President Philippe Diallo has remained tight-lipped about the prospect of Zinedine Zidane becoming the new manager of the France national team. Zidane is considered a favourite to replace Didier Deschamps, who will leave his post in 2026.

Watch: MS Dhoni, Ziva groom their pet dog in 'therapawtic' videoChennai Super Kings shared a video on social media where MS Dhoni can be seen enjoying quality time with his pet dog, accompanied by his daughter, Ziva. While Dhoni gently brushed the dog's fur, Ziva lent her tiny hands to assist.

Virat Kohli will be 'super motivated' to end rough patch: Faf du PlessisFaf du Plessis has claimed that Virat Kohli will be 'super motivated' to put behind his poor run of form. Kohli endured a rough patch during the recently-concluded Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia.

Rashford's camp arrives in Italy to hold talks with AC Milan: ReportsMarcus Rashford's representatives are in Italy for discussions with AC Milan over a potential loan deal. With Borussia Dortmund and other clubs also expressing interest, the Manchester United forward's future hangs in the balance after a difficult season under Ruben Amorim.

Rohit Sharma shouldn't play Tests anymore, he made wrong call in Sydney: KaifFormer batter Mohammad Kaif criticised Rohit Sharma's decision to sit out the final match of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Rohit acknowledged his poor run with the bat and took the bold call. India lost the series finale by six wickets and conceded the coveted trophy to Australia.

Stronger than ever, Sabalenka aims for Australian Open hat-trickWorld No.1 Aryna Sabalenka had 2024 as her best year in her career. After starting 2025 with the Brisbane International title, the 26-year-old will be aiming to bag her third Australian Open title.

Michael Vaughan's son Archie to lead England U-19 vs South AfricaArchie Vaughan's leadership of England Under-19s during their tour of South Africa marks a significant milestone in his career. Following a successful season with Somerset, Vaughan aims to inspire his team and build on his rapid rise in cricket.

Glenn Maxwell for Sri Lanka tour? Backward step for Australia, says Ricky PontingRicky Ponting feels that Glenn Maxwell being included in the Australia squad for the Sri Lanka tour will be a backward step for the side. Maxwell has been pushing to make it into the squad for the tour of the island nation in recent times.

SA20 2025 Live Streaming: Squads, schedule and all you need to know SA20 2025: Sunrisers Eastern Cape and MI Cape Town will face each other in the opening match of the tournament. 34 games will take place in the championship with the grand final on Saturday, February 8.

Pakistan denies stadium concerns, says Champions Trophy preparation on track Champions Trophy 2025: Pakistan Cricket Board rubbished rumours of under-prepared stadiums, asserting that renovation work at all three venues -- Lahore, Karachi and Rawalpindi -- will be completed on time. Three venues in Pakistan and Dubai will host the premier 50-over tournament, starting February 19.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
